legalAidSA.name: Legal Aid South Africa
legalAidSA.description: Government-funded organization providing legal assistance to those who cannot afford private legal representation

meansTest.description: Applicants must pass a means test based on income and assets
notes: Income includes salary, wages, grants, and other regular income
Assets exclude primary residence and household goods
Amounts are updated periodically - verify current thresholds

automaticQualification: Children in need of legal representation
Persons facing eviction from their homes

howToApply: Visit your nearest Legal Aid SA office
Bring ID document and proof of income

legalAidOffices.description: Legal Aid SA has offices in all provinces

lawClinics.description: University law clinics provide free legal assistance

ngoLegalServices.name: Legal Resources Centre (LRC)
ngoLegalServices.description: Public interest law firm providing free legal services

ngoLegalServices.name: Section27
ngoLegalServices.description: Public interest law centre focusing on health and education rights

ngoLegalServices.name: Lawyers for Human Rights (LHR)
ngoLegalServices.description: Human rights organization providing legal assistance

ombudsmen.name: Commission for Gender Equality
ombudsmen.description: Promotes gender equality and investigates complaints

ombudsmen.name: CCMA
ombudsmen.description: Commission for Conciliation, Mediation and Arbitration - labour disputes

courtFees.description: Court fees may be waived for indigent persons
process: Complete an affidavit declaring inability to pay
Submit to the Registrar of the court
Registrar will assess and grant/deny waiver

sheriffFees.description: Sheriff fees for service of documents may be waived
process: Apply to the court for exemption
Court may order state to pay sheriff fees

saflii.name: SAFLII - Southern African Legal Information Institute
saflii.description: Free access to South African case law and legislation

govza.name: Government Gazette
govza.description: Official source for South African legislation

smallClaimsCourt.description: For claims up to R20,000 - no lawyers allowed, simplified procedure

plainLanguageGuidance.description: Tips for explaining legal concepts in plain language
principles: Avoid Latin terms - use English equivalents
Explain technical terms when first used
Break complex processes into numbered steps
Use 'you' and 'your' to address the reader directly

commonTermsSimplified.affidavit: a written statement made under oath
commonTermsSimplified.summons: a document telling you to come to court
commonTermsSimplified.subpoena: a court order requiring you to appear or produce documents
commonTermsSimplified.interdict: a court order stopping someone from doing something
commonTermsSimplified.locus standi: the right to bring a case to court
commonTermsSimplified.res judicata: a matter already decided by a court
commonTermsSimplified.prima facie: at first glance / on the face of it
commonTermsSimplified.ex parte: one-sided / without the other party present
commonTermsSimplified.in camera: in private / not open to the public
